description: [Status: stable] [Name: compare-with-tuple] [Message: Use {replacement} instead of multiple equality comparisons] What it does Checks for boolean expressions that contain multiple equality comparisons to the same value. Why is this bad? To check if an object is equal to any one of multiple values, it's more concise to use the in operator with a tuple of values. Example if foo == x or foo == y: ... Use instead: if foo in (x, y): ...
